thread.title: German police raid homes and mosques, arrest Tunisian suspected of planning attack
thread.title_full: German police raid homes and mosques, arrest Tunisian suspected of planning attack

title: German police raid homes and mosques, arrest Tunisian suspected of planning attack
text:
German police raid homes and mosques, arrest Tunisian suspected of planning attack Posted February 01, 2017 19:32:19 Map: Germany 
More than 1,100 German police have searched 54 homes, business premises and mosques in Frankfurt and other towns in the western state of Hesse and arrested a Tunisian man suspected of planning an attack. 
The 36-year-old Tunisian is suspected of recruiting for Islamic State (IS) in Germany since August 2015 and building up a network of supporters with the aim of carrying out a terrorist attack in Germany, Frankfurt's prosecutor general said in a statement. 
It said police had carried out the raids in Frankfurt am Main, Offenbach am Main, Darmstadt, Limburg and Wiesbaden as well as in some other districts. 
Authorities are investigating 16 suspects aged between 16 and 46, including the arrested man. 
The attack plans were at an early stage and there was no concrete attack target yet, the prosecutor general said. 
Peter Beuth, Interior Minister of the state of Hesse, said there had not been any immediate danger. 
"It was not about preventing an imminent attack â€” rather security forces in Hesse intervened early to protect citizens from the threat of harm," he said. 
Mr Beuth added that the officers involved in the raids had managed to "destroy an extensive Salafist network". 
Salafism is an ultra-conservative branch of Sunni Islam. 
On Tuesday, German police arrested three men in Berlin on suspicion of having close links to IS militants and planning to travel to the Middle East for combat training. 
It was the worst of a spate of attacks on civilians in Germany over the past year. 
Reuters
